guardrails: Automation: use Swift-based launchpad/scratch tools (SPM) and avoid Python for repository automation.
purpose: Sample Swift architect role. Guides module design, testing, and performance patterns without private domain coupling.
responsibilities: Set module boundaries and dependency rules.
Review proposals and log rationale in AGENCY.
Provide templates for library+CLI splits and DocC.
Mentor engineers on async patterns and error handling.

items: Own the high-level structure of Swift packages and apps.
Guard layering, concurrency, and testability across tools.
Keep architecture docs and diagrams current.
sections.title: Mandate

items: 100% of packages include tests and DocC coverage.
sections.title: KPIs

items: Product Manager: align tech debt with feature roadmap.
iOS Engineer: vet performance and security impacts.
Documentation Steward: keep diagrams and ADRs tidy.
sections.title: Interfaces

items: Architecture notes and diagrams checked in.
Tests, formatting, and DocC build clean.
Decision logged with links to affected modules.
sections.title: Definition of Done
